channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: StyleTTS 2: Towards Human-Level Text-to-Speech through Style Diffusion and Adversarial Training with Large Speech Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we present StyleTTS 2, a text-to-speech (TTS) model that leverages style diffusion and adversarial training with large speech language models (SLMs) to achieve human-level TTS synthesis.

item.title: GraphCast: Learning skillful medium-range global weather forecasting
item.description: Global medium-range weather forecasting is critical to decision-making across many social and economic domains.

item.title: LCM-LoRA: A Universal Stable-Diffusion Acceleration Module
item.description: Latent Consistency Models (LCMs) have achieved impressive performance in accelerating text-to-image generative tasks, producing high-quality images with minimal inference steps.

item.title: Video-LLaVA: Learning United Visual Representation by Alignment Before Projection
item.description: In this work, we unify visual representation into the language feature space to advance the foundational LLM towards a unified LVLM.

item.title: Qwen-Audio: Advancing Universal Audio Understanding via Unified Large-Scale Audio-Language Models
item.description: Recently, instruction-following audio-language models have received broad attention for audio interaction with humans.

item.title: Mustango: Toward Controllable Text-to-Music Generation
item.description: With recent advancements in text-to-audio and text-to-music based on latent diffusion models, the quality of generated content has been reaching new heights.

item.title: Large-Scale Intelligent Microservices
item.description: Deploying Machine Learning (ML) algorithms within databases is a challenge due to the varied computational footprints of modern ML algorithms and the myriad of database technologies each with its own restrictive syntax.

item.title: S-LoRA: Serving Thousands of Concurrent LoRA Adapters
item.description: To capitalize on these opportunities, we present S-LoRA, a system designed for the scalable serving of many LoRA adapters.

item.title: Plum: Prompt Learning using Metaheuristic
item.description: Since the emergence of large language models, prompt learning has become a popular method for optimizing and customizing these models.

item.title: JaxMARL: Multi-Agent RL Environments in JAX
item.description: This not only enables GPU acceleration, but also provides a more flexible MARL environment, unlocking the potential for self-play, meta-learning, and other future applications in MARL.

item.title: A Survey on Language Models for Code
item.description: In this work we systematically review the recent advancements in code processing with language models, covering 50+ models, 30+ evaluation tasks, 150+ datasets, and 550 related works.

item.title: The Song Describer Dataset: a Corpus of Audio Captions for Music-and-Language Evaluation
item.description: We introduce the Song Describer dataset (SDD), a new crowdsourced corpus of high-quality audio-caption pairs, designed for the evaluation of music-and-language models.

item.title: Aligning Language Models with Offline Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback
item.description: Learning from human preferences is crucial for language models (LMs) to effectively cater to human needs and societal values.

item.title: Black-Box Prompt Optimization: Aligning Large Language Models without Model Training
item.description: However, these models are often not well aligned with human intents, which calls for additional treatments on them, that is, the alignment problem.

item.title: Monkey: Image Resolution and Text Label Are Important Things for Large Multi-modal Models
item.description: Large Multimodal Models have demonstrated impressive capabilities in understanding general vision-language tasks.

item.title: Distil-Whisper: Robust Knowledge Distillation via Large-Scale Pseudo Labelling
item.description: As the size of pre-trained speech recognition models increases, running these large models in low-latency or resource-constrained environments becomes challenging.

item.title: FACTUAL: A Benchmark for Faithful and Consistent Textual Scene Graph Parsing
item.description: Textual scene graph parsing has become increasingly important in various vision-language applications, including image caption evaluation and image retrieval.

item.title: VideoReTalking: Audio-based Lip Synchronization for Talking Head Video Editing In the Wild
item.description: Our system disentangles this objective into three sequential tasks: (1) face video generation with a canonical expression; (2) audio-driven lip-sync; and (3) face enhancement for improving photo-realism.

item.title: Real-time Neural Radiance Caching for Path Tracing
item.description: Since pretraining neural networks to handle novel, dynamic scenes is a formidable generalization challenge, we do away with pretraining and instead achieve generalization via adaptation, i. e. we opt for training the radiance cache while rendering.

item.title: The Rise and Potential of Large Language Model Based Agents: A Survey
item.description: Many efforts have been made to develop intelligent agents, but they mainly focus on advancement in algorithms or training strategies to enhance specific capabilities or performance on particular tasks.
